662130640.name: One of the top beaches I\'ve visited!
662130640.author: a TripAdvisor user
662130640.reviewBody: We stayed at the W Hotel Punta de Mita.  From the hotel entrance to the beach, we could walk for miles to the left.  The beach was beautiful: sugary sand, easy to walk/run on, and the mountains decorating the backdrop of the ocean made the view exceptional.  We walked from our hotel for about 2 miles (the tide needs to be low) where there was a beautiful rock formation in the shape of a whale.  On the way, off of some high cliffs, there were so long hanging cacti which were photographically noteworthy.  \nI definitely want to return!

657119925.name: beautiful place
657119925.author: a TripAdvisor user
657119925.reviewBody: nice and quite area , beautiful place , you can see whales from the beach , many trips  go from here at the COOPERATIVE at the end of town .

644865640.name: It was a nice visit
644865640.author: a TripAdvisor user
644865640.reviewBody: Interesting beach but they only allow a short visit. It was a nice visit but not so nice I\'d return a second time.

631758505.name: Beyond belief beautiful.
631758505.author: a TripAdvisor user
631758505.reviewBody: You cannot go wrong at Riviera Nayarit Mexico, beauty and nature abound here.  Stayed at the IB*PM for the seventh time.

629500843.name: Great little town, the place to go for good food.
629500843.author: a TripAdvisor user
629500843.reviewBody: Short cheap $10 cab ride, safe little town, great food, really nice people with wonderful service, more of a typical Mexican place with vendors walking the beach.  Boat rides and fishing available.

626965445.name: Nice Little Village with Beautiful Beach and Good Restaurants and Shops
626965445.author: a TripAdvisor user
626965445.reviewBody: Punta Mita is a nice little village located right on the beach.  Beautiful to look at and lots of surfers.  Some nice shops and many good restaurants, several of which enjoy beachside locations with beautiful views (sunset is especially nice).   Very different than Sayulita and a couple of hours here, followed by lunch or dinner at a beachside restaurant, is about right.

585884254.name: We loved this sleepy town
585884254.author: a TripAdvisor user
585884254.reviewBody: This is a great tiny town with delicious fresh food and long stretches of ocean for paddleboarding, snorkeling and several nice surf spots.  The town is home to several high end resorts so there seem to be an abundance of eating choices for such a small town.  We hope to return.

583363868.name: Clean beach in Mexico
583363868.author: a TripAdvisor user
583363868.reviewBody: Very safe place and wonderful to visit. Everything you need within walking distance! If you have a chance stay at the Villas Las Olas with David and Lisa. They have the best villas in the area.

580403216.name: A good alternative to Sayuita
580403216.author: a TripAdvisor user
580403216.reviewBody: We heard that Sayulita has a sewage-in-the-ocean problem and opted to stay in Punta de Mita to be closer to where we wanted to surf. This village is surrounded by large, expensive all inclusive resorts, but the town itself is more of an authentic village. There are touristy restaurants and a little strip along the beach, but for the most part, strikes me as undeveloped. Perhaps it is the next Sayulita?

571788628.name: rocky
571788628.author: a TripAdvisor user
571788628.reviewBody: Playa looked good. Was a busy area to  park. Some rocks in the area we were. Popular for boating trips.

657571303.name: Beautiful beach, but you can\'t get there.
657571303.author: a TripAdvisor user
657571303.reviewBody: Playa La Lancha is a great beach, good surfing.  However, it is inaccessible.  The only access is a mile hike through the jungle and the property owners have closed it off with fencing and guards armed with pepper spray.

654339327.name: Surfers highway threw a Jungle trail
654339327.author: a TripAdvisor user
654339327.reviewBody: We entered down the road at the entrance to the left of the surf . Access on the inside of the rent a cops . Large sign saying public access to the beach. Fences on both sides lead you to the beach. Workers on one side building development jungle on the other. We went for the nature trail and birds and check out the surfers. Busy on Tuesday the day we went. Lagoon was pretty quiet its dry season not alot of activity. Exited the beach on the trail that goes threw the jungle and ends at the surf shop. Felt like a highway of surfers and people. Narrow trail so had to get off to let people pass with their surf boards.Enjoyed the walk a place to chill and watch the surf. Local buses stop right out front of entrance. Easy bus ride from local hotels and so cheap compared to taxis. Run about every 10 to 15 minutes.

652151842.name: Great surf spot
652151842.author: a TripAdvisor user
652151842.reviewBody: Two trails lead here one is under scruinity by some rent a cops hired by a resort development company which wants to take over the access.  Lots of politics here.  Let\u2019s hope they keep this beach open

645984428.name: SUPER NASTY LOCALS, ARROGANT SURF SCHOOLS, GIANT ROCKS COVERED IN URCHINS
645984428.author: a TripAdvisor user
645984428.reviewBody: The place is really really crowded and basically a pain in the a**. First, Its totally taken over by surf schools that bring a ton of beginners by boats & cars from the nearby towns, and have them floating in the middle of the line-up on their giant foam boards. When you try to take off there\'s gonna be a ton of clueless kooks on getting on your way. But there are also skilled locals who get really nasty if you know how to surf, and they\'ll band against you and block you making sure you won\'t catch anything. The vibe sucks. If it\'s low tide, there are huge rocks right at the take-off point, covered in urchins.

632627715.name: hidden beach
632627715.author: a TripAdvisor user
632627715.reviewBody: Hard to find but great beginner waves, the walk is far but well worth it. Wear hiking shoes and ask the locals how to find it and it is paradise!

616458460.name: Easy, uncrowded waves surrounded by nature
616458460.author: a TripAdvisor user
616458460.reviewBody: My husband and I enjoyed surfing La Lancha last May. The walk through the "jungle" was fun and worth the isolation from civilization - beautiful beach! There were a fair number of locals and tourists in the line-up on a Sunday, but we had the break to ourselves on a Monday. I was so happy to find waves that were perfect for my ability - easy, but not too easy. There were large rocks (boulders/coral?) in the water so if you have no experience surfing I would exercise caution, but coming from my home break I appreciated the clarity of the water where I could see the hazards below (where I just feel them at home haha). \n\nIf you\'re a non-surfer, the beach is lovely and the break is far enough out that you can swim/splash in the water without worrying about surfers running you over. No amenities.

586839250.name: No Surf Beach. Locals are aggressive. Hidden giant rocks.
586839250.author: a TripAdvisor user
586839250.reviewBody: Lugare\u00f1os aun sin saber surfear, son agresivos con turistas avent\u00e1ndolos hacia las rocas. \n\nEven locals without knowing how to surf are aggressive with tourists pushing them to the rocks.

585884065.name: great beginner surf spot
585884065.author: a TripAdvisor user
585884065.reviewBody: Although sometimes crowded with surfers even in the off-season the gentle but real waves were a great place to improve surfing skills.

580402575.name: LOVED this beach!
580402575.author: a TripAdvisor user
580402575.reviewBody: Excellent surf, a couple shady spots, nice clean sand, fun walk through the woods to get there. Loved it!!!

573114178.name: Perfect surf beach
573114178.author: a TripAdvisor user
573114178.reviewBody: Make the trip to La Lancha especially with your boards! Watch for the alligator in the river. It is a little bit of a walk but beautiful path.

571122666.name: Beautiful beach
571122666.author: a TripAdvisor user
571122666.reviewBody: Great beach to catch some waves and have a beach day without having to share the beach with too many people. There is a small walk to the beach but the reward is worth it!

566060436.name: Well keeped little secret
566060436.author: a TripAdvisor user
566060436.reviewBody: Thanks to my neighbours who live here full time for taking us there ... we had seen cars parked on the side of the road but never guessed that the path lead to such a cute beach.

564629337.name: Hike-in beach
564629337.author: a TripAdvisor user
564629337.reviewBody: A beautiful, out of the way beach. Be prepared for a hot hike into it, but a nice reward upon arrival.

665387003.name: Cute Shop
665387003.author: a TripAdvisor user
665387003.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this shop if you are in Punta Mita. Beautiful unique items. Bought a wonderful handtooled leather purse there.

address.streetAddress: Rinconada Careyeros # 59

425990662.name: Excited to see the new series of work coming up!
425990662.author: a TripAdvisor user
425990662.reviewBody: We are very proud to feature Jane and Chris\'s work in our beach accommodations. Having an original design from the studio create an amazing element to our space that is both natural, original and beautifully engineered. Personally, the movement on the mobile is more intricate and fascinating to watch when manipulated by the ocean breeze, than any piece of art I have had in my life before. We love the mobiles and are equally excited to acquire a custom made furniture piece from the studio in the near future. As Jane and Chris continue to create and evolve into other areas of art and design, we will follow suit and eagerly await the next series. Thank you for making your art and sharing it with all of us.

address.streetAddress: Rinconada Careyeros # 59

418897062.name: Awe-Inspiring One-of-a-Kind Mobiles
418897062.author: a TripAdvisor user
418897062.reviewBody: Spending an afternoon with Jane Maroni and Chris Nielsen at their Organic Design Studio near Punta Mita is an awe-inspiring experience. Their \u201ceco-motion sculptures\u201d are like nothing you\u2019ve ever seen before. They are a combination of art, engineering and design and are made from things found in nature and repurposed. The organic shapes, gentle and fluid rotation, and the way these sculptures somehow remain perfectly balanced in mid-air is absolutely mesmerizing. I currently have 4 stunning mobiles displayed in my home, which help calm and inspire me every\u2026 single\u2026 day.

address.streetAddress: Rinconada Careyeros # 59

418629309.name: A magical place!
418629309.author: a TripAdvisor user
418629309.reviewBody: The Jane Maroni Organic Designs studio is an enchanting place. To walk-in and not only take in the gorgeous artwork, but to simultaneously see the beautiful ocean view as a backdrop is priceless. You are instantly filled with a sense of peace and relaxation, as you see the Kinetic Air Sculptures effortlessly rotate as if they were uniting in a melodic dance. Experience the magic for yourselves. Make an appointment today.

address.streetAddress: Rinconada Careyeros # 59

675061068.name: great place
675061068.author: a TripAdvisor user
675061068.reviewBody: very happy with the food and prices.. wonderful people and great service will ensure you enjoy your visit !! highly recommend.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

661231878.name: fun day.
661231878.author: a TripAdvisor user
661231878.reviewBody: We spent the day here and had a great time. We rented beach chairs at the Blue Shrimp and the waitstaff was great.\nWe also rented a surf board for our son who had a great time and we rented a boat which took us out to Marrietta islands for a couple of hours. Great way to spend the day.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

645598516.name: Awesome surf lessons with Oso Negro!
645598516.author: a TripAdvisor user
645598516.reviewBody: Oso Negro is a local legend in Punta de Mita and an incredibly nice, genuine guy! He gave our son some awesome surf lessons and organized for us an unforgettable hike to the Monkey Mountain (Cerro del Mono). You will also get to meet his fun little dog Neptuno, who rides waves with him... To schedule an appointment, just ask for Oso Negro at any of the restaurants in El Anclote, preferably La Caba\u00f1a, Lobster Paradise or Rocio and someone will call him on his cell phone for you!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

624282053.name: GORGEOUS Beach!
624282053.author: a TripAdvisor user
624282053.reviewBody: This is a peaceful and gorgeous beach and one of our favorite places to be!! It is our little hidden treasure!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

613511366.name: Charming restaurant great spot!
613511366.author: a TripAdvisor user
613511366.reviewBody:
We went with a group at friends and our children and had a blast!
Peaceful, aunthentic, decorated with very good taste. Delicious frozen margaritas!
The kids can play on the beach while you enjoy your coffee or margaritas, the sea in very calm. 
We loved it and will go back for sure

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

580399978.name: Rocks in the water
580399978.author: a TripAdvisor user
580399978.reviewBody: there are people who surf here, but be warned, there are tons of rocks just under the surface that will beat you up good. Better to go over to Stinkys

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

579080218.name: Nice quiet bar.
579080218.author: a TripAdvisor user
579080218.reviewBody: This bar means "the anchor". We went there because we have an "anchor bar" back home. We had to stop here for a beverage and the view of the ocean.  Unlike our "anchor bar", they did not serve chicken wings.  Friendly staff and nice surroundings though.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

571127347.name: Great Beaches in Punta Mita; Family Oriented
571127347.author: a TripAdvisor user
571127347.reviewBody: The Punta Mita beaches are clean and so is the water.  El Anclote is a very relaxed, Family oriented beach restaurant where you can sit on the beach or inside, as you prefer.  I have only been here for lunch but it was exactly the right pace with prompt, friendly service.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

558003484.name: We love this place!
558003484.author: a TripAdvisor user
558003484.reviewBody: We are a group of friends that enjoy sup surfing and we love this beach and restaurants. It\u2019s low key and a home away from home. The locals are lovely and it\u2019s usually way quieter than our town of Sayulita. Shhh. It\u2019s a secret!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

557818997.name: Great location
557818997.author: a TripAdvisor user
557818997.reviewBody: We spent a month in punta mita. My kids and I were there the whole month and my husband was able to come for two weeks.  We had a wonderful time! The unit was clean and nice!!!  The other buildings have a lot of retired people in them.  They constantly are looking to turn you in for something.  We were allowed 6 people in the unit.  Our friends visited while our husband was there and they had an eight week old baby.  They turned us in!  If you have kids I would recommend staying across the way.  They are much more family friendly with larger newer units.  If you are without kids this is the place for you.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

552513297.name: Nice little beach restaurant in El Anclote.
552513297.author: a TripAdvisor user
552513297.reviewBody: Good prices, good Mexican style menu. They have both indoor and out door seating. No reservations needed here.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

540439826.name: Basic, Plain, Peaceful
540439826.author: a TripAdvisor user
540439826.reviewBody: This beach is a bit rocky, small, and plain. The water was murky the day we visited. The place is pretty scarce and not worth driving to see if that is the focus. It is a decent stop off point to check out the area as we did, yet not worth a full day.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

540119431.name: good place for food and trips
540119431.author: a TripAdvisor user
540119431.reviewBody: great place for food restaurants  and trips to fish whale watching or go snorkel around the islands spent much time here , good place

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

538074825.name: Good meal, really good service, great spot
538074825.author: a TripAdvisor user
538074825.reviewBody: All around good place to eat or have a drink by the water.  They serve high good quality meat and fish. The service is fast, effective and courteous. Do not hesitate to ask for a recommendation from your waiter, they are committed to giving the best dining experience possible.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

536934760.name: Day Trip
536934760.author: a TripAdvisor user
536934760.reviewBody: We came here for a day trip 16 family members, and they were the best.  We ate, drank and swam for hours.  We got to hang out 1/2 the day here.  Food was excellent, wait staff were kind and attentative and the scenery was the best.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

499611713.name: Fishing Boats & Restaurants
499611713.author: a TripAdvisor user
499611713.reviewBody: There are plenty of beach front restaurants along this area.  We stayed walking distance from the fishing boats and restaurants.  Certain areas are rocky but the beaches south of it are not.  Nice place to check out.\n

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

492303941.name: very romantico, accogliente..
492303941.author: a TripAdvisor user
492303941.reviewBody: this is the second time in elenclote. we stay at the hotel meson de mita.. small ma great place for  been close to the fishing, dollar value and service. elenclote is a small village, about one thousand people.. many rastaurants,some with quality food and ambiance//

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

481085876.name: Gorgeous
481085876.author: a TripAdvisor user
481085876.reviewBody: Punta de Mita...gorgeous! We went there for the day...we took a drive from Nuevo Vallarta. It was worth it! I think it has the most beautiful beach in Nayarit. We stopped to take pictures and had a few drinks at some bistro on the beach. Any bar/bistro is great...just have a drink...,and watch the view of this beautiful beach.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

477763910.name: Ocean was nice
477763910.author: a TripAdvisor user
477763910.reviewBody: The water was much nicer here than anywhere else in Puerta Vallarta Area.    Beach very small.   They only rent plastic chairs that sit up.   Rent them from locals including an umbrella.   No beach loungers.   Uncomfortable.   Waves were nice.   A lot of surfers, or actually paddle boarders using boards to surf.   Lot\'s of boats to look at.   Nice little fisherman village with shopping and restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

464828609.name: good food on the beach
464828609.author: a TripAdvisor user
464828609.reviewBody: We had dinner late afternoon here.  Good spot with a great view of the beach and the bay. You can have a tasty filet mignon here for 200 pesos believe it or not ( $ 10). Service was great and the entire meal was quite enjoyable. Also serves Mexican and Seafood cuisine.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

450223067.name: Nice beach
450223067.author: a TripAdvisor user
450223067.reviewBody:
The water in December was calm and great for paddle boarding.  Water was clean and refreshing after hot day.

Closer to shore there was decent boogie-boarding for kids.  In the morning beach was empty while filling up in the afternoon.  Occasionally surf increased to allow for paddle surfing.

Sand stretches for miles which is nice but watch out for rocks in water (ouch!). 

We'd go back there anytime!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

428788364.name: :S
428788364.author: a TripAdvisor user
428788364.reviewBody:
we have been going there for the past 6 years...one a year aprox.. each year they do something better to the restaurant (like floor, fans, etc) but unfortunately the menu has suffer , each year less dishes beside eggs ... they jsued to have a vgreat "machaca"...
the orange juice used to be fresh, now im pretty sure is from the box. 
The staff is not as friendly as years ago, they didnt explain the $100 pesos packege after we order, they didnt refill the coffee...never ask if everything was ok with the dishes ones they were served,.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

424411551.name: Large white sand beach
424411551.author: a TripAdvisor user
424411551.reviewBody: This is "the" beach in Punta de Mita.  A couple miles of white sand beach stretching the northern length of the Bay of Banderas looking southward to PV which is 30 miles away.  Several restaurants along the beach.  Good beginner surf when there is a swell.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

418934796.name: Disappointing
418934796.author: a TripAdvisor user
418934796.reviewBody: I was really looking forward to dining at El Anclote. Is was looking forward to their Pescado Zarandeado. Unfortunately the fish fell well short of my expectations. We also had a shrimp cocktail which was not very good. The service was good, but the food is not.  I do not recommend this restaurant when in Punta de Mita.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

398155986.name: Ok, but not great.
398155986.author: a TripAdvisor user
398155986.reviewBody: Nice people, good food, but fairly standard fare. Wait staff tries a little too hard, which is no fault of their own, but perhaps a little training would help.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

395414828.name: Great Choice
395414828.author: a TripAdvisor user
395414828.reviewBody: We\'ve had lunch here several times. Menu, kitchen and service are excellent, as well as the location. Anclote is on an pebble beach, boats for Marietas Islands depart only a few steps away. During low season, staff at Anclote will take care of your belongings while you take the tour.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

380055040.name: Quaint little street of Punta Mita
380055040.author: a TripAdvisor user
380055040.reviewBody: cute little place in Punta Mita. There is public access to the beach right next to Hotel Cinco. The break there is super gentle, it is dubbed "Mexican Malibu", but for it to happen, the swell has to be 3-5 ft at Punta Burros.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

379449114.name: Fun town
379449114.author: a TripAdvisor user
379449114.reviewBody: Authentic and fun! Great food and nice surf. Very friendly village. Love the Cinco Hotel! Las Cabanas has great local food too.\n

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

372363119.name: This is a great traditional beach restaraunt with good food and excellent service  Love the owner Lety...
372363119.author: a TripAdvisor user
372363119.reviewBody: You will enjoy you day at the beach here.  You can swim, have a table and umbrella on the beach, and enjoy your time with you new friend.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

370281706.name: Always a delight
370281706.author: a TripAdvisor user
370281706.reviewBody: Love the ceviche here!  Thanks to Letitia and Christian for their hospitality.  Great fun to watch the surfers and paddle boarders while drinking a bucket of Pacificos...

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

369706887.name: Punta Mita Trip 2016
369706887.author: a TripAdvisor user
369706887.reviewBody: I described this area as the "Drag" or Main Street of the town. As you walked down the hill from where we stayed, we were approached by salespeople promoting the boat ride to the Marietta Islands. There are pharmacies and small boutique shops on the right side of the street.  Along with N/Shore Realty. The shops on this side had the best selection of straw and string hats as well as gorgeous tablecloths or bedspreads that were reversible.The pottery was beautiful.  Walking down the opposite side you encountered all the hotels and restaurants that were beachfront.  Interspersed between the bars/restaurants and hotels, there were small mercado boutiques that had items ranging from jewelry, bathing suits, flip flops, hats, artsy wall and home pottery, and other items for sell. There are about 4 pharmacies on the "Drag". This main street got you to "Oso Negro" Surf Instructor Extrodanaire.  He was recommended to us and we valued his lesson knowledge for beginner surfing lessons and paddleboarding also.  We also asked him for advice on other general information. Super nice man.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

369614261.name: Nice beach, surfing is ok
369614261.author: a TripAdvisor user
369614261.reviewBody: Nice beach, with several bars and restaurants, looking out on the beach.   Surfing was ok, nice little wave, but watch out for the rocks!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

358843732.name: Best place to eat
358843732.author: a TripAdvisor user
358843732.reviewBody: We tried most of the restaurants in Punta de Mita during our stay.  Unfortunately we waited till our second last day to try El Anclote.  It was the best place we ate so went back our last day as well. Make this your first stop not your last.  Food was excellent so was service.  They are right on the water.  Prices were lower than many of the other places on restaurant row.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

348335387.name: Loved this place
348335387.author: a TripAdvisor user
348335387.reviewBody: Beautiful view, really tasty food, service was great, we stayed at La tranquila on Jan and someone just recommended this place to us and we loved it!. \nGreat Job!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

345581836.name: Excellenta
345581836.author: a TripAdvisor user
345581836.reviewBody: Had a beautiful and tasty lunch and very generous drinks. Fair price and excellent dining experience. Great service, great food and drinks with a spectacular view..\nMake sure you visit.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

343588477.name: Great food and location!!!
343588477.author: a TripAdvisor user
343588477.reviewBody: This is a family run business and is a top notch restaurant. Not over priced like some on Anclote beach. The food is excellent, specializes in seafood, but also has other delicious plates. Full bar with top shelf brands. And check with them for music nights and " Yummy, guest chef" specialties. The lobster plate is filling and scrumptious. Leticia is the owner and hostess, and will make you feel right at home. Tell them Dianne sent you!!!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

335296126.name: Self Guided
335296126.author: a TripAdvisor user
335296126.reviewBody: Take a taxi or bus to this original Punta de Mita village. Go to the Fising Co-op to arrange your own boating or fishing trip. The whole boat is 60 an hour.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

317139464.name: Laid back, relaxing in Punta Mita!
317139464.author: a TripAdvisor user
317139464.reviewBody: We stopped in for a couple of beers in the middle afternoon and we were glad we did.  The staff was very friendly and the beers were cold.  We sat under a straw umbrella right on the beach, with a perfect view.   Loved It!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

310576969.name: Quiet Beauty
310576969.author: a TripAdvisor user
310576969.reviewBody: Very quiet beach town with high end restaurants and hotels. El Anclote condos sit high on the side of a hill over looking the beautiful beaches. The complex is well taken care of and the condo we stayed was beautifully equipped with all you could ask for! We also had a wonderful art exhibit in our condo, amassed by the owners over their travels all over Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

310126438.name: Average beach
310126438.author: a TripAdvisor user
310126438.reviewBody: Looking at our reviews we do like beaches and always give an honest review.  This was not that great  to be honest but still enjoyable to hang out and relax.  My partner surfs so whilst I sat sunbathing he caught some waves, though not for long as he said it was rather rocky in places.  We did not use any of the local facilities etc, was just a quick couple of hours away from it all though still nice and relaxing.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

309560950.name: HANG OUT & ENJOY
309560950.author: a TripAdvisor user
309560950.reviewBody: Great view..great for hanging out.. they need a better bartender the mix drinks kinda sucked.you can bring your own snacks but purchase a drink or two so you don\'t get kicked out. other than that awesome...

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

306762751.name: Good to dinner & hang around
306762751.author: a TripAdvisor user
306762751.reviewBody: This is the nearest dinner place you can find if you are staying in one of the condos at Punta de Mita. It has a few shops with

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

295395460.name: Great time at The Original Anclote!
295395460.author: a TripAdvisor user
295395460.reviewBody: Thank you Leticia and staff for taking such good care of our family in such a busy week.  They all loved hanging out with you and enjoying tasty snacks and drinks with their feet in the sand!  You\'re the best!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

272120185.name: El anclote
272120185.author: a TripAdvisor user
272120185.reviewBody: The surf was fun and most of the locals were friendly. The curios shop ripped off our credit card by $500 but apart fro that we loved the area. Hope we can get a refund and not have a totally negative experience

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

259444010.name: Great waves and friendly surfers
259444010.author: a TripAdvisor user
259444010.reviewBody: Easy for anyone to paddle out and catch a wave. Everyone was super supportive and lots of waves for all skill sets.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

258856570.name: A good beach strip
258856570.author: a TripAdvisor user
258856570.reviewBody: It has several different beach front restaurants, some excellent.  Also the local cooperativa has many different boat and fishing tours as well as whale watching in season.  The beach is not always the best for swimming because of rocks, some of which are cleared.,

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

256544963.name: Great Beach area.
256544963.author: a TripAdvisor user
256544963.reviewBody: This is a nice beach with a few restaraunts and surfing vendors along the way. We rented a Stand up paddle board and had a great time. A few days earlier, we were there and there were lots of great waves and surfing. Very friendly and safe area.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

255271899.name: Relaxing
255271899.author: a TripAdvisor user
255271899.reviewBody: Nice, quiet beach. No loud music blaring your ear, no hassle street vendor. Just a nice stretch of beach with a bit rocky sand here and there, good restaurants, warm and friendly people. A very nice place to just sit, relax, and unwind.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

239812171.name: Fun day trip and great area
239812171.author: a TripAdvisor user
239812171.reviewBody: The area around here has a great selection of restaurants and the mood is very laid back. The bus goes all the way from Puerto Vallarta and the road ends right up the hill from the beach. The beach is peaceful and the waves are perfect for a beginner surf instruction. We rented a boat from Oscar and went out to Las Marietas islands. I feel that this is the best way to get out there- it\'s really quick (compared to coming from the marina) and much cheaper. The whole area has a great tranquil vibe about it and I can\'t wait to go back.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

235917601.name: Easy to get to and fantastic restaurants!
235917601.author: a TripAdvisor user
235917601.reviewBody: I take the bus up the coastal road from Bucerias to El Anclote. It\'s easy to get to, the bus rout stops there! El Corral is a great restaurant where you can spend the afternoon. No waiters rushing you. Eat, drink, take a swim, the come back for more. You actually have to ask for the bill. So stay and play all you want!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

234640764.name: Great staff and food :-) Great view of sunsets!
234640764.author: a TripAdvisor user
234640764.reviewBody: Dined there many times. Always good with nice presentation.  Friendly staff!  Have had our fresh fish prepared there to perfection. Recommend trying it! Many nice restaurants along the main road with great ocean / sunset views!!\nComfortable and pet friendly!!\n

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

230935794.name: Tasty food!
230935794.author: a TripAdvisor user
230935794.reviewBody: Great food and great service!\nThe server gave a 10% off coupon to use during our stay!\nWould definitely go back!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

228213913.name: Great beach... But kind of private
228213913.author: a TripAdvisor user
228213913.reviewBody: Pros: the Beach is really nice for surfing and paddle board.\nThe sand is whiter, not like Vallarta.\nCons: you only get access to the beach in certain areas. Most of the peninsula is closed. So if you are not staying at a hotel inside or going to the golf course then you have to stay in the restaurants and shops area.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

226345712.name: Wave break right by Quinta Del Sol
226345712.author: a TripAdvisor user
226345712.reviewBody: The Swell takes a strong hurricane swell or macking southern swell to come alive but when it works, it makes for long rides off the point, great vibe in the crowds and is ideally suited for a longboard.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

219488290.name: Nice calm beach
219488290.author: a TripAdvisor user
219488290.reviewBody: Nice calm beach with a good variety of local food restaurants on the cheap side but with good homemade seafood dishes. Gets a bit crowded on weekends

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

211419795.name: Not crowded with tourists
211419795.author: a TripAdvisor user
211419795.reviewBody: little spot out of the way... great \'beach\' access club... (only pay about $1.30 per beer) and great food (just no chicken or beef) everything seafood.  Very nice people... had a great massage next door at \'Remy\'s\' ... the water is MUCH cleaner and more blue there... (no idea why)... great day trip!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

209818857.name: Awesome for lunch
209818857.author: a TripAdvisor user
209818857.reviewBody: A buddy and I dropped in here for a couple of cervezas and a little snack. Great friendly staff. Outstanding shrimp cocktail. Cold beer. Beautiful view. Dirt cheap. Worth it!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

203736819.name: Fantastic spot
203736819.author: a TripAdvisor user
203736819.reviewBody: El Anclote is located at the entrance to Punta Mita.  There are several restaurants, a fun beginner surf spot, a few surf rental shops, and people renting fishing boats.  We highly recommend Mictlan Surf School.  We rented surfboards, standup paddle boards, and took multiple boat trips with them.  The staff at Mictlan Surf School are all amazing.  They are knowledgable about the surf, the fishing, the whales, and the Marietas Islands.  If you don\'t speak Spanish, they speak English.  Their rates are fantastic.  Their equipment is stellar.  We were staying in Sayulita but drove to Anclote multiple times to surf with Mictlan Surf School.  Next trip, we plan on staying at the the Hotel Meson de Mita in Anclote and going to Sayulita once in a while.  If you want more advanced surf, hire Mictlan Surf School to take you and your boards to a nearby surf break on one of their boats.  We went to La Lanche for a sunset surf and two weeks later are still talking about it and looking at the photos the photographer from Mictlan Surf School took for us.  The SUP tour of the Marietas Islands is not to be missed either.  Have fun.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

198007645.name: wonderful surprise
198007645.author: a TripAdvisor user
198007645.reviewBody: location on the beach, thought it was just a beach bar but it is more than that friendly staff and owner, food surprisingly good, will definitely go back

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

193689162.name: Quaint little fishing village
193689162.author: a TripAdvisor user
193689162.reviewBody: Good for photo ops, browsing in a few shops, lunch/dinner on the beach. Don\'t miss the fish tacos. We enjoyed La Cabana, El Dorado and El Coral restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

190089698.name: Mexico "Lite" beach with good to great paddle board/surfing
190089698.author: a TripAdvisor user
190089698.reviewBody: El Anclote sits at the entry to the private Punta Mita resort which is home to the Four Seasons and St. Regis resorts as well as various massive villa-style beach homes. Once a local fishing village, El Anclote is now the low to mid-budget location at the mouth of the Punta Mita penninsula. The small town is notable for the various restaurants that line a nice beachfront, the fisherman and boats who shuttle visitors out to snorkel, surf at nearby boat-in surf breaks, and for the gentle rolling surf that at times can break for hundred of yards.\n\nEasily accessible for Puerto Vallarta (40 min) and Sayulita (20 minutes), El Anclote, if you hit it right, has terrific beginner surf conditions which are always ideal for paddle boarders and sometimes reward longboarders as well. Definitely worth a visit if you\'d like a glimpse of old-time  beachside Mexico with the joy of the waves nearby.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

184881569.name: Lovely pool, safe, guarded-tennis courts
184881569.author: a TripAdvisor user
184881569.reviewBody: Has a private bridge walking bridge to town, feel safe, our condo is well furnished 3101.  Lovely patio overlooking the ocean w/ table for 6-8 and grills outside.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

184831819.name: over rated punta mita
184831819.author: a TripAdvisor user
184831819.reviewBody: be carful if you are considering staying here. Do your research as you could be very dissapointed like we were. Food was average, beaches are nothing special and the town is dirty and overpriced.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

181529179.name: Our absolute favourite restaurant in Punta de Mita
181529179.author: a TripAdvisor user
181529179.reviewBody: Can\'t begin to say enough about this Mexican beach front restaurant. Next door to the renown La Artista restaurant - this family owned establishment prides itself in consistent quality and service. No doubt one of the big reasons why they have remained in business for so many years. When we want to get away from all the hustle and bustle and enjoy a beautiful view - a fine Mexican meal & a margarita this is one of our favourite destinations. \nHighly recommend it - you won\'t be disappointed!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

178024563.name: The best place for bigginer surf
178024563.author: a TripAdvisor user
178024563.reviewBody:
I love anclote beach,  It where i learn to surf as my kids and wife.
I been visiting this beach for 15 years now,  always beautiful always diferent ,,but one thing for sure,,very quiet.
The a whole ave, full of good restaurants.  All are good,each of them has an especiality.
Now,, i live in Punta de Mita, fell in love of this town.
And very good street vendors that unfortunetly are not in tripadvisor like tamles lady, Normas place, Doña Rosa lunch place. Fresh cocunot guy. 
Walk around too.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

167310574.name: Breathtaking
167310574.author: a TripAdvisor user
167310574.reviewBody: Crystal clear blue water, stunning rock formations and white sand. The water is a little rocky and not necessarily ideal for swimming but a perfect place to surf, paddle board or watch the sunset!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

156649589.name: Great location but a bit noisy
156649589.author: a TripAdvisor user
156649589.reviewBody: We\'ve rented here 3 times. But the dogs and roosters start early and the late night music in the bars out front can be a little tough. \nThere\'s alot of full-time retirees living here that definitely keep an eye on behavior and what\'s going on. Guess it can be a good thing, but I couldn\'t help feeling like I was under my parents watchful eye :)

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

155542396.name: Fun, easygoing, unpretentious
155542396.author: a TripAdvisor user
155542396.reviewBody: We had a great time, had lunch over at El Anclote. Fish is delicious,I highly recommend asking for "pescado sarandeado".\nNice spot to just chill, eat and do nothing else while enjoying the view.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

151982786.name: Great Place to Stay
151982786.author: a TripAdvisor user
151982786.reviewBody: The grounds and staff that work there are wonderful.  The pool is always refreshing but the views from your condo are spectacular.  Friendly people always around.  Wish I could live there all year long!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

147385475.name: Great place to eat and chill waiting on a perfect wave
147385475.author: a TripAdvisor user
147385475.reviewBody: Coral Restaurant has a great Ceviche, and service is super!\nThere is a great wave in front. It was small while I was there, but I can see, and I also hear it is really nice when it works.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

147371777.name: Great place to stay on vacation.
147371777.author: a TripAdvisor user
147371777.reviewBody: Not a Hotel.  This is a condo project.  Property is kept up nicely and there is a wall with gates that make you feel safe while visiting. The property management staff is very helpful and there are some nice people who live there all the time.  It is their home and it is fun to interact with so many people from different parts of the world while sitting at the large pool or hot tub.  Enjoy!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

146841348.name: El Anclote was a very cool surf town
146841348.author: a TripAdvisor user
146841348.reviewBody: I liked how small it was and how uncrowded the streets were.  It looked like they had some excellent condominiums that were 3 stories which probably had an excellent view.   It would be a good place for a beginner surfer or paddle boarder to learn.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

138032357.name: Loved it!
138032357.author: a TripAdvisor user
138032357.reviewBody: The restaurants were great! We had several dinners there. Ate at El Dorado and Margaritas, shopped at the cute boutiques too!  Shopping for jewelry was fun! The people were friendly. Loved it!!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

132734371.name: Good mexican food in a typical mexican beach
132734371.author: a TripAdvisor user
132734371.reviewBody: Good food and fun mexican athmosphere. Good for lunch

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

128083736.name: Great Local Food
128083736.author: a TripAdvisor user
128083736.reviewBody: Take a cab for around 12.00 to this neat little village - and enjoy a table in the sand - the people that own this restaurant absolutely want to ensure you have the best of everything - we had great sea food - cold beer and wine and the pounding surf - the owner - she will try to make your experience the best

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

126520574.name: Love it
126520574.author: a TripAdvisor user
126520574.reviewBody: i Have a condo here , its a nice place full of a few  stores and tons of great Resteraunts. it gets a bit loud at night, but other than that its a great place

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

125943488.name: Worth a drive!
125943488.author: a TripAdvisor user
125943488.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this charming fishing town.  You can surf  or just enjoy the expansive and semi private beach alongside local fisherman, and lunch or dine with many good restaurant options.\nDon\'t miss dinner at Cafe des Artistes del Mar while in Anclote.\nthis is a 5 star dinning experience!  Order the fresh tuna sashimi appetizer and the flamed fresh prawns in tequila.  You will love it all!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

124719980.name: A great place to sit and spend the day
124719980.author: a TripAdvisor user
124719980.reviewBody: Nice little fishing village with a fantastic beach and restaurants. You can easily spend the day here. And best of all, the bus ends right at the El Corral restaurant. After food and drinks, the bus will take you back to Bucerias, or Vallarta

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

124045831.name: Nice quiet day
124045831.author: a TripAdvisor user
124045831.reviewBody: We took the ATM bus out of PV Northbound. Easy to get on it stops in front of the Walmart and other locations along the main ave where you can get on. It is 23 pesos to get on and it takes you past Bucerias and North on to Punta de Mita. It is the last stop and the buses run frequently. It does take about 1 hr to get there. Once there you get off the bus walk directly down the hill to quiet beach of El Anclote and it is a beautiful beach. It is very peacful and a good way to spend the day out of the busy PV area.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

122465235.name: Great beach with perfect surf waves.
122465235.author: a TripAdvisor user
122465235.reviewBody: Bring water shoes because there are rocks from the tide coming in and out.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

122198027.name: Beautiful beach & close to Marietas Islands for snorkeling
122198027.author: a TripAdvisor user
122198027.reviewBody: We took a bus from Puerto Vallarta to Punta de Mita to go to the beach. It saved us a ton of money over taking a cab plus we got to see a lot more of Mexico but it did take a couple hours. We had a snack at one of the restaurants and we played in the sand for a little while. The waves are not too strong and the sand is nice and soft so it was perfect for the kids. We asked the waiter if he knew of anyone who could take us to the Marietas Islands and he recommended Thomas. My husband paid him $100 USD and he took the 4 of us out for 3 hours to snorkel. It was an amazing time. The Marietas are only about 15 minutes from Punta de Mita rather than a couple hours if you leave from the Marina in Puerto Vallarta. When we came back from our snorkerling trip the restaurant workers were really nice about letting us use their bathrooms to change. The hotel manager at one of the hotels even walked us over to the bus stop to make sure we got on the right bus. Everyone in the area was really friendly and helpful.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

121330488.name: A Little on the Pricy Side
121330488.author: a TripAdvisor user
121330488.reviewBody: I love the beach at El Anclote and have visited for years eating at the wonderful little places on the beach.  I always thought that to sit with my feet in the sand was fun and a little rustic.  This time I was shocked at the prices charged to sit with my feet in the same sand I have put them in for 20 years and pay so much for my dinner.  It is still an exotic place to be, the sand is still warm and inviting and I still loved being there.  So, I would go again!

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

61107038.name: Great condo, location
61107038.author: a TripAdvisor user
61107038.reviewBody:
We were in Punta de Mita in Feb 2010 to attend a family wedding and reunion.  Some of us stayed at the El Anclote condos.  The complex consists of 5 buildings, each with 3 floors and an elevator.  It's gated, has parking, and a pool.  It is nicely situated on top of a small hill, which affords each condo beautiful, breathtaking, panoramic views of Banderas Bay.  We had a corner pent house condo, and it was quite large - 2-bedrooms, 2-bathrooms, kitchen, laundry room, living/dining room, foyer, high ceilings, spacious balcony.  Our condo had A/C, which came in handy.  There were towels (bath and beach), laundry detergent, kitchen-ware, etc. for our use.  Although some condos could use a little updating, some were very well-maintained.

There are plenty of activities in the Punta de Mita area:  golfing, fishing, ziplining.  The kids had a blast learning to surf with Ricardo Andrade of Olas Vallarta.  And we had a chance to take a boat trip to Las Islas Marietas.  It was hard to snorkel there as the seas were a bit rough that day - but we enjoyed watching the humpback whales along the way.  One of the wedding activities was a ladies' event at the Villa Ananda Spa - it was heavenly practising yoga by the beach in the morning sun.

Regarding the condos, the only advice I have is to make sure you get what the owners (or brokers) advertise, and what you paid for.  This is true for all condo rentals, not just at the El Anclote.  For instance, our condo advertised satellite TV, but there wasn't one - in fact, there was only one channel.  We were there at the time of the Olympic games, and my family wanted to watch some of the events - one of the reasons I chose this condo was because it had satellite TV.  My husband and teenagers went across the street to the Hotels des Artistes to get their Olympic fix.  Another false advertisement:  the walkway/bridge for direct access to the beach is closed indefinitely, due to some legal problems.  We had to use the car to drive my 84-year-old father-in-law across the street, as he had difficulty negotiating the steep hill to the beach and restaurants.  The condo also had a telephone number where people could reach us - the only problem was, there wasn't a telephone in the condo!  I reported the problem to the broker we had been dealing with for the condo rental, but no phone appeared.  Unfortunately, with wedding and family reunion activities, we made so many local calls.  I just received my cell phone roaming charges, which is why I'm writing this review!   

Before you hand your money over, just double-check everything that's being offered.  Go through the list with the owner/broker, get expectations out in the open, and identify big-deal items.  Renters should be compensated if the owners don't fulfill their end of the deal.  And ask for a contact (preferably a local one) who can be entrusted to sort out problems - quickly.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

56591831.name: Breathtaking Views, amazing condo for amazing value, all good restraunts and great surf! Will be back soon.
56591831.author: a TripAdvisor user
56591831.reviewBody:
As of feb. 2010 El Anclote is a paradise waiting to be explored. My wife and I just spent 17 days in the condo and had an amazing time that cant be put into words. We have travelled around a lot to Costa Rica and Hawaii but for us this takes the cake. We are already planning our return trip to Mexico and are excited to explore more of this life filled country. 

We had the pleasure of staying in a condo owned by Tom and Joanie Ogg from San Diego, a one bedroom with full kitchen and everything you could want and more. The view from the patio was over the restraunts and to the beach where a long right hand wave breaks forever. The condos are totally safe and sound, no contstuction in town and the dirt road that was is now a nice new stone road with sidewalks and clean safe parking. We also found that they have upgraded the sewage treatment plant and created many new squares and parks. 

I have nothing bad to say about the condos or the town of enclote, the only sour feelings come from those tourists who do not respect the locals and treat it as there play/trash ground. These people are everywhere though and can only be ignored. 

Great people, food, surf, everything. 

Go to Accion surf shop for your gear, great guys and Margaritas for dinner, The original Enclote was our fave for breakfast and we loved the new deli with paninis and coissants. 

Thanks !

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

26963498.name: Great Place to Vacation in Mexico
26963498.author: a TripAdvisor user
26963498.reviewBody: This is a great spot off the beaten path. El Anclote has a nice pool area and direct skywalk to the beach area. Its completely gated and secure. Most rooms, especially those on the 2nd and 3rd floors have an amazing view of the bay. Take a look at my photo, its a panoramic of the view from a 2nd floor condo. The food is fantastic, I prefer the El Dorado restaurant out of the local seafood joints down here.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

24601601.name: Anclote
24601601.author: a TripAdvisor user
24601601.reviewBody: We stayed in the condos and found the construction is over, i didnt smell any thing like sewer but i did see a drainage ditch that drained to the boat launch area rather than the beach. The beach itself is best for surfing rather than swimming... We were there to fish so really not so important to us.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

18028359.name: El Anclote Sewer
18028359.author: a TripAdvisor user
18028359.reviewBody: The little town of El Anclote where the El Anclote Condos and restaurants are located (and various other condo complexes) is not recommended for beach goers nor children, ok for surfers.  The water is brown from the jetty construction, the beach front road was an open raw sewage pit, the sewage treatment plant sends the treatment down a open canal directly into the ocean.....will not let my kids go swimming, bummer location, stay nearby, Four Seasons side of the point is beautiful as is just south of El Anclote.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

12349497.name: Construction warning Punta de Mita
12349497.author: a TripAdvisor user
12349497.reviewBody: We are staying in the condos El Anclote, Punta de Mita.  Our condo is everything the write-up said it would be but they neglected to tell us about the construction that has been on-going since 2006 and is not finished yet.  We arrived Dec 19, 2007, tired and looking forward to our condo and were greeted with the sounds of generators, chainsaws, tilecutters, you name it that concerns construction and it directly in front of us in full view and sound from our lovely 3rd floor deck.  Be aware of construction going on before you book, it can be very disappointing.

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

5328353.name: Beautiful beach
5328353.author: a TripAdvisor user
5328353.reviewBody: Having previously spent time to the south of Puerto Vallarta, it was interesting to see the differences in beaches and seascapes up north. Near Playa Anclote and Punta de Mita, the sand is much whiter, and the water much bluer, compared to the southern parts of the Bay of Banderas. It\'s almost Caribbean-looking! We had a delicious lunch of fresh seafood at the palapa restaurant on the beach at Playa Anclote. There are very few tourists this far north, and only one vendor approached us. You can rent a panga here if you want to visit the Marietas Islands.\n

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

5144578.name: Better Beach than Hawaii, by far!
5144578.author: a TripAdvisor user
5144578.reviewBody: Can you muster a one hour drive north on the free highway to Anclote in Punta Mita?  If so, you are in for a treat.  By far the calmest, most family friendly beach in the Vallarta region.  We had a car, drove north for about an hour to Punta Mita, home of a few resorts, the fabulous 4 Seasons, etc.   We drove along the coast and ended up at an esplanade or roundabout.  You can go straight or down to the beach at the roundabout. Go left down to the beach and park at the El Dorado retauraunt on the beach.  Go in, secure a prime palapa and table in yourt sling back chairs overlooking the bay, order whatever you want, we had the cameron quesadilla, the best ever, Mismaloya is second best!  OK, the best thing about this beach, no waves, clear blue/green water, very Mediterranean like, the sand is super soft.  Good snorkeling, you can walk out 100 yards and be waist deep very little if any rocks, 99% sand!  Lose yourself in this bay from the El Dorado.  Magnificent.  It was tough to leave.  By far, the cleanest, softest sand, best snorkeling (take a pair of goggles), and just perfect beach.  THe palapas provide plenty of shade, El Dorado likes the real palm palapas and they throw in a bunch of green and gold umbrellas for those with fair skin to seek refuge.  Being an Oakland A\'s fan, I felt tight at home! I was looking in one of the Vallarta promotional magazines a day or 2 later and the picture was from the El Dorado, promoting another timeshare or something.  It truly is picture perfect, great retaraunt, view, experience.  I loved it.  If you have an extra day or 2, Yelapa, and Anclote!  Make it happen!  Bring a towel and some sunscreen, enjoy what very few other tourists experience.  A great experience, enjoy!\n

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

1836096.name: Bluto
1836096.author: a TripAdvisor user
1836096.reviewBody: Take the island tour from Anclote Beach on the sailboat Bluto. It is simply the best and most authentic Tourism you will ever get in Puerto Vallarta. David

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia

838716.name: Laidback and loved it!
838716.author: a TripAdvisor user
838716.reviewBody: El Anclote Condominiums in Punta Mita....gorgeous views of the Bay of Banderas!  A gated community with tennis court and wonderful pool & spa.  Somewhat isolated (45 minutes to Puerto Vallarta); a rental car is nice to have (but expensive); luckily, taxis and buses are plentiful.  Several excellent restaurants on the beach just a short walk away!  We especially liked the El Dorado (tell Hector that Linda "with the horseradish" sent you!).  Nice beach, but take water shoes with you if you plan to body surf, etc.....the last hurricane left lots of rocks!  This is a spot we will definitely return to!\n

address.streetAddress: Av. Los Redes #70 Nuevo Corral del Risco Colonia
